meanings.definition: To strip (something) of its covering or surface layer.
meanings.sent1: The strong winds were denuding the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were denuding the old building of its paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denuding the garden of all its flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist denuding the canvas of all color, leaving only black and white.
meanings.sent5: The river denuding the banks, revealing the smooth stones beneath.

meanings.sent1: The archaeologists were denuding the ancient ruins to reveal their secrets.
meanings.sent2: The storm denuding the landscape of all vegetation.
meanings.sent3: The magician denuding the table of all its props, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The writer denuding the character's emotions, exposing their raw vulnerability.
meanings.sent5: The sun denuding the snow-covered mountains, exposing their majestic peaks.
